title: Embedded video playback issues in 97.0.1
content: I recently downloaded 97.0.1 for Mac and ever since that time, embedded videos, whether from Facebook, Twitter, or news sites, take forever to start playing or start and stop endlessly. Anyone have any sense what could be causing this? I'm running it on Monterey 12.2.1. Thanks in advance!
creator: goldsteinunited

title: disable CTRL+SHIFT+C developer tools shortcut
content: I need developer tools, for some tasks. F12 shortcut is fine. I have ubuntu linux, CTRL+SHIFT+C is used for copy from terminal. I want copy something from firefox to terminal. Every time I press CTRL+SHIFT+C developer tools appear instead of coping text. Pressing CTRL+SHIFT+C again does not close developer tools. So need to press F12. Select text one more a press CTRL+C. Is it possible to disable CTRL+SHIFT+C shortcut? Is there any fork with this shortcut disabled?
creator: vojacet

title: Printing from Firefox - Cutting off right side of document
content:
With update 97.0.1 (this has gone on now for almost a year), I lost the ability to print any documents from Firefox without losing about 20% of the document off the right side. This includes pdf's, orders from my website, FedEX labels, UPS labels, and a lot of other options. I am now forced to use Chrome as my "default" browser so I can get a fully printed document. Let's take PDF's for example.. I can download them, then print them from Adobe Reader and they are fine, but not if I open them in Firefox and print from the browser. This issue is the same regardless of what I am printing.

Help! I want to use Firefox as my default browser again.
creator: hunter.fitzgerald

title: firefox keep changing my location in youtube
content:
Dear Sir,

Firefox browser keep changing my location in youtube setting when I refresh the page or when I close the browser and re-open it again. And this only happens with Firefox browser, I try Chrome and Edge Browsers and does Not have this problem. I try to clear everything but still the problem goes on.

My Firefox version: 97.0.1 (64-bit) My OS: Edition Windows 10 Pro Version 21H2 Installed on ‎3/‎3/‎2022 OS build 19044.1526 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.4170.0

Best Regards, Thank you in advance
creator: zzzgzozv12

title: email tabs
content: I always used Mozilla to access my yahoo account. From their was a tab for my yahoo email accounts. What do I do now as there is not tool bar or email tabs. How do I access my yahoo email addresses???
creator: lewispreston

title: STG-Backups-FF folders in downloads folder
content:
I've read that these folders are created by an add-on called Simple Tab Groups. However, I don't have this add-on - or if I do, it's well hidden. It doesn't show up on a list of extensions.

How do I stop these folders/files from being created?

Thanks, Bruce S
creator: bes_stpmn@yahoo.com

title: firefox
content: Firefox four fort
creator: Dexterorvillesmith01

title: button F12 ---> empty cache and forced reload
content: How do i activate this option in mozila? i need to do this for a site of mine here to work, and i can't, only on google. I am Brazilian and the print is in EN-BR, the red markup, I put in English in the title of this ask
creator: vitoralvesferreira123

title: Chronic total failiure meltdown
content: Going on for years.Driven crazy by FF on desktop Have to close it down about 7 times before it loads up, as it just hangs. My connection is fine. Billions of mozilla has crashed messages over the years Randomly out of stab in dark changed settings to no proxy -which worked for a bit Cleaned cookies /cache - again makes only temprary difference -then back to nonsense Tried cleaning today through manage exceptions settings - ( which apparently has the cache /cookie size of all visted websites........................and there are no websites there listed FF is up to date and i had to restart FF 5 times after posting this. This is getting silly.
creator: RobJavierW140

title: Time out trying to load a video.
content:
When loading a recorded video from https://www.worldsbk.com/ it fails to load. Times our instead. This has been going on since last October. There had been a recent update but I can't confirm that it coincided with the failures. It had worked for several years with no problem.

I have the latest Firefox update and level. Running Windows 10 fully updated.
creator: klwill946

title: Interference from MSN ?
content: When I open Firefox icon, MSN Bing browser opens, not Firefox. How do I stop the MSN jumping in?
creator: ShambaLetuANGE

title: Issues when composing a hotmail email
content: When attempting to compose a Hotmail email, without provocation, the email will leave the screen altogether, landing in either 'draft' or 'sent'. If I'm replying to an email, the reply will disappear into draft or sent folders, and the original gets thrown into the archive folder (or some other folder). The auto-fill option has a tendency to not include vowels. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: cjeveringham

title: Gráficos se ven mal en Firefox
content:
Hola Espero que estén bien, el problema que traigo es que actualice algunos drivers y la computadora se comporta bien pero ... los gráficos en Firefox normal (no modo seguro) se ve mal, al leer probé en modo seguro en modo seguro y están perfectos, mi pregunta es ¿como puedo poner la configuración del modo seguro en el normal para que tenga la misma nitidez?

Quería poner dos imágenes de pantalla diferentes para que se vea la diferencia, pero al tomar las imágenes de pantallas las dos se ven nítidas, y al comparar las imágenes del monitor de la laptop con la del monitor externo, en el externo se ve mal y en la laptop se ve bien (esta conectado por hmdi).

Agregue fotos tomadas por mi celular y se ve la diferencia estan en Firefox normal (no modo seguro)

agradezco sus respuestas, tenganme paciencia pues de programación, hardware y navegadores, sé muy poco.

Saludos desde Mazatlán

title: Browser stopped warning that page has changed 97.0.1 (64)
content:
[article Oct 2018]

This is suddenly happening to me! Please help.

Thank you.


MarkMJ MarkMJ 10/25/18, 1:46 PM

So there was an issue where my browser stopped automatically restoring my previous session after closing it. I followed some instructions I found online that told me to tick the option for it under Options -> General -> Startup, and this fixed the problem. However, this seemed to have caused my browser to directly close and stop asking me to save and quit even while browser.ShowQuitWarning is set to true in about:config.

If I tick off the option to automatically restore my previous session, however, I do get a warning that tells me I'm about to close my browser, but it only gives me the options to close tabs and cancel closing my browser; the option to save & quit is absent entirely.

That's about everything I know that could be related to this issue.

title: Can't sign in to Medium.com on Firefox
content:
I've tried deleting cookies. I tried to add it to a list of exceptions to enhanced blocking, but I have it set on Standard, and it won't let me add exceptions.

When I access the site through FF and Chrome, I don't even get the same home page. It seems FF is bringing up some old Medium homepage that is no longer functional. It sends you a sign in code through your email, but that doesn't work to sign me in. It also won't let me sign in through Google or Facebook or anything else.

After the last upgrade, I got a message saying MS Defender was blocking some of FF's functions. It had a link to click to fix this, but it disappeared too quickly for me to do it. I don't know if this is the problem, and I don't know how to fix that.

There are many websites now that I can't reach. I'll click a Google link and get a "This site is not available" message or "Can't find this address" or something else, but I can access them perfectly well with Chrome.

I've been using both FF and Chrome, but I never had to do that before the major programming changes you made. I could use FF for anything. I see why FF has lost so many users since these big changes. It just doesn't work properly anymore. Maybe Mozilla should ditch all this enhanced protection and just give us a browser that works.

content:
I do not know why I bother posting when it is easier to just uninstall all Mozilla products on any device where I might have used them reliably in the past but cannot any longer. Firefox no longer runs on my Windows 7; in fact it does not even open. That is as of your last update when the crashing began, almost two months ago though it seems longer. As for this Mac Catalina, the only system I have where I can access these pages, Firefox looks like garbage. Pages do not download entirely. Check-off boxes, click buttons and drop down menus often do not work. For all the updating on Catalina this Firefox underwent, these problems never get fixed.

I do not understand the relationship Mozilla has with SeaMonkey; but I can no longer log into my Account there on MozillaZine; and there is no alternative way to contact them. My Profile does not show when I login. It will not allow me to establish a new Account with other email addresses I use. It constantly crashes on Windows 7. The SeaMonkey browser will not open these pages on attempts to login. Since these problems with Firefox are persistent, I was going to post about them on MozillaZine, which I cannot do any longer. There is no means of reporting login problems there. Additionally, some Apple commentators on their forums believe that SeaMonkey is a storage hog. I have kept it here because it works reasonably well despite the Account problems.

SeaMonkey has the reputation of not getting rigorous support. Between that and Firefox I do not know which is worse. As I stated before in a previous thread, the check off box below does not show a check when I click on it. I hope it is clear that I am posting this through Firefox on my Mac. The Submit button is faint.

title: Corrupted File Downloads Through Firefox Browser Often Occurs
content:
Hi. I've noticed that files downloaded through the Firefox browser very often come out corrupted. Just to keep in mind, I'm always on the latest version.

Nowadays, I download the same file multiple times and compare their checksums to see if any two or three are identical matches to be more certain that it turned out as it should. This is an extremely tedious and troublesome task and a waste of bandwidth and time, especially when some files like video footage shot from a high-end camera for film production can be extremely large (25-100 GB per file) and it needs to be shared and downloaded multiple times by a number of group members that are working on the film project to compare checksums to see if they match. In our case, we provide the checksums for the files before uploading to the cloud, so our members can check against it after they've downloaded the file to ensure none of frames in the footage are corrupted.

However, in most cases, the problem arises when Firefox users download something online that often doesn't have checksum they can check against. Even if they downloaded the same file two times with their checksums matching, it doesn't 100% guarantee that they aren't corrupted, since the same piece in each of the two files could be corrupted at the same spot, although very unlikely but still a possibility. Everyone in our group has very stable internet connections via ethernet cable, and not WiFi.

Could this issue be looked into to figure out what the problem is?
creator: Prezal
